metadata.title: CVE-2022-36946 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.description:
nfqnl_mangle in net/netfilter/nfnetlink_queue.c in the Linux kernel through5.18.14 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (panic)because, in the case of an nf_queue verdict with a one-byte nfta_payloadattribute, an skb_pull can encounter a negative skb->len.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-36946` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.19.0-21-generic - 5.19.0-15.15
linux-image-5.19.0-21-generic-lpae - 5.19.0-15.15
linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-21-generic - 5.19.0-15.15
linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-21-generic-64k - 5.19.0-15.15
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1008-kvm - 5.19.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1009-aws - 5.19.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1008-azure - 5.19.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1008-gcp - 5.19.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1008-ibm - 5.19.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1007-lowlatency - 5.19.0-1003.3
linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1007-lowlatency-64k - 5.19.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1008-oracle - 5.19.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-5.19.0-1004-raspi - 5.19.0-1002.6
linux-image-5.19.0-1004-raspi-nolpae - 5.19.0-1002.6
No subscription required
